name: Calabrese Broccoli
info: Broccoli is classified in the Italica cultivar group of the species Brassica oleracea.
description: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family whose large flowering head, stalk and small associated leaves are eaten as a vegetable
additionalInfo: The word broccoli, first used in the 17th century, comes from the Italian plural of broccolo, which means the flowering crest of a cabbage, and is the diminutive form of brocco, meaning small nail or sprout.

name: Banana
info: Bananas contain essential nutrients that may enhance heart health, help manage blood pressure.
description: A banana is an elongated, edible fruit botanically a berry produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa
additionalInfo: In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called plantains, distinguishing them from dessert bananas

name: Pistachios
info: Pistachios are a great source of healthy fats, fiber, protein, antioxidants, and various nutrients, including vitamin B6 and thiamine.
description: The pistachio, a member of the cashew family, is a small tree originating from an area that includes Afghanistan, Central Asia, and Iran.
additionalInfo: The tree produces seeds that are widely consumed as food.

name: Red Tomato
info: They are a great source of vitamin C, potassium, folate, and vitamin K.
description: Tomatoes are loaded with a substance called lycopene. It gives them their bright red color and helps protect them from the ultraviolet rays of the sun.
additionalInfo: Tomatoes also have potassium, vitamins B and E, and other nutrients.

name: Mung Bean
info: Mung beans are a good source of protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, making them a nutritious addition to any diet.
description: They are low in calories and fat and have a low glycemic index, which means they can help regulate blood sugar levels.
additionalInfo: It is commonly used in Asian and Indian cuisine and is known for its numerous health benefits.

name: Brown Hazelnut
info: They are high in healthy fats, protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, including vitamin E, magnesium, and potassium.
description: Brown hazelnut, also known as filbert, is a type of nut that grows on the hazel tree.
additionalInfo: Brown hazelnuts have a hard, brown shell that encases a creamy, pale-yellow kernel. They have a sweet, nutty flavor and a crunchy texture.

name: Eggs
info: Eggs are a good source of protein, vitamins, and minerals, including vitamin D, vitamin B12, iron, and selenium.
description: They are a popular ingredient in many cuisines around the world and can be a healthy addition to a balanced diet.
additionalInfo: Eggs consist of two parts - the yolk and the egg white.

name: Zelco Suji Elaichi Rusk
info: Zelco Suji Elaichi Rusk is a type of Indian biscuit that is made from a mixture of semolina (suji), cardamom (elaichi), and sugar.
description: Rusk is essentially a twice-baked biscuit that is first baked until it is lightly golden and then baked again until it becomes crispy and dry.
additionalInfo: It is typically enjoyed as a crunchy snack or dipped in tea or coffee.

name: Courgette
info: Courgettes a good source of vitamin C, vitamin A, potassium, and dietary fiber.
description: Courgette, also known as zucchini, is a type of summer squash that is commonly used in a variety of dishes around the world.
additionalInfo: They are low in calories and high in nutrients, making them a healthy addition to any diet.

name: Cashew
info: Cashews are a good source of protein, healthy fats, and minerals such as copper, magnesium, and phosphorus.
description: Cashews are a type of tree nut that are native to Brazil but are now widely grown in many tropical regions around the world.
additionalInfo: They are also a rich source of antioxidants, which can help protect the body from harmful free radicals.

name: Corn
info: It is a good source of dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals such as thiamine, folate, and potassium.
description: Corn, also known as maize, is a cereal crop that is widely grown around the world for both human and animal consumption.
additionalInfo: Corn is also processed into a wide range of food products, including cornmeal, corn flour, corn syrup, and corn oil.

name: Almonds
info: Nutritionally, almonds are a good source of protein, healthy fats, fiber, and a variety of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin E, magnesium, and potassium.
description: Almonds are a type of tree nut that are native to the Middle East but are now widely cultivated in many regions around the world.
additionalInfo: They are also rich in antioxidants, which can help protect the body against harmful free radicals.

name: Cauliflower
info: It is a good source of vitamin C, vitamin K, folate, and potassium.
description: Cauliflower is a cruciferous vegetable that is closely related to broccoli, kale, and cabbage.
additionalInfo: Also contains smaller amounts of other vitamins and minerals, including calcium, iron, and magnesium.

name: Vegettable marrow
info: This vegetable is a good source of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C, vitamin A, and potassium.
description: Vegetable marrow is a type of summer squash that belongs to the same family as zucchini and pumpkin.
additionalInfo: It is also low in calories and high in fiber, making it a healthy addition to any diet.

name: Onion
info: They are a good source of vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants.
description: Onions are a vegetable that belongs to the Allium family, which also includes garlic, shallots, and leeks.
additionalInfo: They can be eaten raw, cooked, fried, or roasted, and can be used as a base for many sauces and gravies.

name: Cabbage
info: Cabbage is also a nutrient-dense vegetable that is low in calories and high in fiber, vitamin C, and vitamin K.
description: Cabbage is a leafy vegetable that belongs to the Brassica family, which also includes broccoli, cauliflower, and Brussels sprouts.
additionalInfo: It also contains antioxidants and other beneficial plant compounds that have been linked to various health benefits.
